articles.title: DPRK Ambassador to Democratic Congo Appointed
articles.content:
DPRK Ambassador to Democratic Congo Appointed
 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- Ri Myong Chol was appointed as the DPRK ambassador e. p. to the Democratic Republic of Congo, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Performance of Extravaganza "Arirang" Continues
articles.content:
Performance of Extravaganza "Arirang" Continues
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", a "Kim Il Sung Prize" laureate, is staged at the May Day Stadium located on Rungna Islet of Pyongyang amid great interest of peoples at home and abroad.
					The extravaganza is a monumental masterpiece of the new century which was created with the folk song "Arirang" as its seed by combining the question on the nation's lot with the history of the Korean revolution. 
					
					It, which consists of a prelude, four acts and a finale, shows the ideological and thematic content in an ample and graphic representation.
					
					The prelude in which the title "Arirang" appears with the rising sun as the background, and Act 1 impressively represent with famous songs the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung who liberated the ruined country.
					
					Act 2 "Arirang of Songun" depicts the reality of the country rapidly developing thanks to Songun and the happy life of its working people with peculiar dance movements, cheerful songs and gymnastic formations full of vigor.
					
					Conspicuous in the current performance is Act 3 "Arirang of Happiness".
					
					Graceful movements of dancers with flowers and ribbons in their hands and stunts of acrobats lead the audience to a mysterious and fascinating world.
					
					Act 4 "Arirang of Reunification" and the finale "Arirang of Prosperity" represent well the strong will of the Korean people to reunify the divided country and build a great, prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					All the scenes, songs and the pictures and words on the background reflect the reality of Juche Korea as it is.

articles.title: Ryongpho Revolutionary Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Ryongpho Revolutionary Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The Ryongpho Revolutionary Site was visited by General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Aug. 26, Juche 90 (2001) while providing Songun revolutionary leadership. It is now drawing a large crowd of servicepersons, people from all walks of life and school youth and children everyday. 
					 On that day of August Kim Jong Il looked round the revolutionary relics in the place which President Kim Il Sung visited despite a hail of bullets and shells in April Juche 40 (1951) when the Fatherland Liberation War raged and personally worked out an operational plan for the defence of the east coast and encouraged commanding officers and model combatants of the combined unit of the Korean People's Army to perform feats. 
					
					 He underscored the need to preserve the precious revolutionary relics and mementoes and historic sites in their original state and manage them with good care, indicating the tasks and ways for conducting an effective education through them.
					
					The number of the servicepersons, people from all walks of life and school youth and children who visited the revolutionary site has been on the steady increase over the past eight years since his field guidance, totaling more than 460,000.

articles.title: New History Books off Press
articles.content:
New History Books off Press
 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- New books "Biography of Korean Martial Art Masters" (vol. 5) and "Synoptic History of Korea" (vol. 1) were published in the DPRK.
					 The former writes about King Kwanggaetho who laid a solid foundation for unifying the three kingdoms and demonstrated the powerful national strength.
					
					 The latter, a revised version, reviews the Korean history from the primitive age to the end of the 14th century.
					
					 The book shows the indomitable struggle and creative ingenuity of the Korean nation who beat back foreign invaders and created a brilliant culture to greatly enrich the treasure-house of the human culture.
					
					 It amends and supplements some parts of the history on the basis of successes made in research into the primitive and ancient history and departmental histories after the Mausoleum of King Tangun was discovered in Juche 82 (1993).

articles.title: Japan Should Win Confidence of Int'l Community, First of All
articles.content:
Japan Should Win Confidence of Int'l Community, First of All
 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- It is the long-cherished ambition of Japan to get permanent membership of the United Nations Security Council and emerge a political power.
					 To this end Japan regards this matter as a core issue in implementing its foreign policy.
					
					 This year, too, Japan singled out the above-said matter as the most important task of its diplomacy and has been hectic in its efforts to fulfil it. 
					
					 The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan officially specified in its 2009 "diplomatic blue book" that it should sit on the UNSC as early as possible. 
					
					 Diplomatic officials including the foreign minister have been busy with money and solicitation diplomacy in the international arena, openly making a bid for the permanent membership. 
					
					 Can this bid be interpreted as a proper one?
					
					 This bid of Japan has been coolly responded to wherever it was made. 
					
					  For all desperate diplomatic efforts Japan failed to convince the international community. Nobody else is to blame for this. 
					
					 Japan is not prepared politically and morally to fit for the above-said post. 
					
					 In a word, Japan has failed to win the confidence of the international community because it has not yet settled its past history woven with so many crimes. 
					
					 More than six decades have passed since the Second World War during which Japan did so awful damage to humankind but it has persistently shunned the settlement of its past crimes, a due legal and moral obligation as a war criminal state.   
					
					 It is nonsensical to give Japan a chance to sit on the UNSC so that it may exercise its say over major pending political issues in the international arena as it has shown no will to settle those crimes. 
					
					 In this context Japan should sincerely repent of its crime-woven past. This is not for the sake of others but for its own sake. 
					
					 Japan lacks the ability to judge the reality that it can never achieve its political purpose unless it earns the international confidence.
					
					 This is evidenced by the fact that far from redeeming its hideous crimes committed in the past Japan is getting talkative about "international contribution", while intensifying the moves for militarization and overseas aggression. 
					
					 The world people are becoming more cautious as the days go by about the above-mentioned bid of Japan. 
					
					 The number of the countries which clarified their official stands not to support Japan's bid is on the steady increase. Signature campaigns opposing Japan's bid were widely conducted in different countries including Asian countries. 
					
					 It is quite natural that Japan can hardly win international confidence as it is so politically imbecile that it still thinks money is everything and is once again rushing headlong into aggression, far from drawing a lesson from its crime-woven past. 
					
					 Japan should settle its past crimes, first of all, if it wants to exercise any right in the international arena.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Redeem Its Past Crimes
 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- On July 30 U.S. Congress raised stronger demand calling for internationalizing the issue of the crimes related to "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese army. This indicates that the harder Japan works to evade its responsibility for its past crimes, the more strict and vehement the international community becomes in its attitude critical of them. 
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes this in a signed commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The crimes related to "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese army are crimes against humanity as they were a product of the Japanese imperialists' most hideous policy of insulting women. They forcibly drafted hundreds of thousands of women of Korea and other countries of Asia and forced them to provide sex to troops of the Imperial Japanese army by use of government and military power.
					
					 The Japanese government has, therefore, a legal and moral obligation to honestly admit and officially apologize for those crimes and make state reparation for them.
					
					 Japan, however, adamantly refuses to admit its crimes, while making desperate efforts to cover up or deny the crimes, in particular.
					
					 This goes to prove that Japan is, indeed, a degenerate state bereft of even the elementary moral face to exist on earth as a member of the international community.
					
					 It is quite self-evident that the sound development of the international community can hardly be expected as long as such a country politically corrupt and morally depraved is allowed to continue behaving so.
					
					 Japan should be brought to the U.N. human rights court to face stern judgment of justice and human conscience. 
					
					 It would be well advised to respond to the demand of the international community as early as possible, well aware that its persistent evasion of its obligation to redeem its past wrongs would only drive it into a tighter corner.

articles.title: U.S. Strategy for Preemptive Nuclear Attack Blasted
articles.content:
U.S. Strategy for Preemptive Nuclear Attack Blasted
						
 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists are pursuing a strategy for preemptive nuclear attack in a bid to hold military hegemony in Asia-Pacific. This strategy is mainly targeted against the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed article.
					 What merits attention in the U.S. imperialists' preparations for a war of aggression against the DPRK is that they have massively beefed up aggression troops in and around the Korean Peninsula after making the start of a nuclear war a fait accompli and always keep themselves busy with nuclear war exercises targeted against the DPRK with a large number of nuclear means involved, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S., attaching great importance to the strategy for invading the DPRK, seeks to escalate the military stand-off on the peninsula and develop it into a war in a bid to realize its wild ambition to put the whole of Korea under its control. 
					
					 If the above-said scenario for a nuclear war is put into practice, this will bring irrevocably serious consequences.
					
					 In case a new war breaks out on the peninsula, it will inevitably spill over into vast areas of the world including those countries whose strategic interests in the region are intertwined with each other.
					
					 It is entirely thanks to the powerful military capability of the DPRK that has emerged an invulnerable fortress under the banner of Songun that a nuclear war has been averted on the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. warlike forces had better drop their anachronistic wild dream to implement their policy of aggression against the DPRK by force and immediately stop the reckless anti-DPRK saber rattling.

articles.title: Intensified Struggle for Independence against U.S. Called for
articles.content:
Intensified Struggle for Independence against U.S. Called for
 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front issued a statement on Tuesday on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of the AINDF, according to Kuguk Jonson (Internet.) 
					 The statement said that the 40 years covered by the AINDF were a shining course in which it has strengthened in every way a driving force for the revolutionary movement in south Korea under the banner of the great Juche idea, the Songun idea, and powerfully encouraged and promoted with its might the movement for national liberation, democracy and independent reunification. 
					
					 It went on: 
					
					A particular mention should be made of the fact that the AINDF has joined the patriotic people from all walks of life in strenuously waging a massive struggle for promoting the independent and peaceful reunification of the country despite the blatant challenge of the anti-reunification forces under the uplifted banner of "By our nation itself" by swimming with the strong trend of the era of the June 15 reunification ushered in by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The patriotic cause of the AINDF is commanding widespread support and encouragement from the Korean people and the world progressives and its influence is increasing with each passing day for its validity and positive struggles.
					
					 The patriotic people from all walks of life should intensify the struggle for independence against the U.S. in order to put an end to the U.S. imperialists' colonial domination and military occupation of south Korea, bearing in mind that there is neither democracy nor reunification without independence.
					
					 The organizations of the movement for the nation and democracy should wage an incessant movement for the withdrawal of the U.S. troops in different places and launch as an immediate task a dynamic struggle for peace against war in order to foil the north-targeted war moves of the bellicose forces keen to bring the dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over this land.
					
					 The AINDF together with the people from all walks of life will take the lead in the sacred struggle for independence, democracy and reunification in the future, too, and thus perform its historically important mission and role as people's patriotic vanguard in south Korea.

articles.title: Ulji Freedom Guardian Slammed by Nepalese Organizations
articles.content:
Ulji Freedom Guardian Slammed by Nepalese Organizations 
 Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- The Nepal-Korea Friendship Association, the Nepalese Committee for Promotion of Reunification of Korea, the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal, the Nepal Institute for the Juche Studies, the National Press Club of Nepal, the Forum for Self-Reliance Studies of Nepal, the Nepal Journalist Association, the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics, the Action Committee for Peace of Nepal, the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Nepal and the National Association of Mass Media of Nepal issued a joint statement on Aug. 19 in denunciation of the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities. 
					 The statement bitterly condemned the large-scale UFG joint military exercises, noting with serious concern that the situation on the Korean Peninsula is further deteriorating due to the saber rattling. 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The ongoing military maneuvers are aimed to invade the DPRK and mount a surprise preemptive strike at it to all intents and purposes. In view of this situation the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army ordered the entire army, all the people and the whole country to be put on a special alert. This is an entirely just measure taken by the DPRK to defend its sovereignty, dignity and socialist system.
					
					 The statement demanded the U.S. withdraw its troops and all nukes from south Korea for the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and peace and stability in Asia.
					
					 Meanwhile, the chairman of the Colombia-Korea Association of Friendship and Culture in a statement issued on Aug. 18 denouncing the UFG expressed full support and solidarity with the Korean people in their just cause.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership Marked in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Revolutionary Leadership Marked in Bangladesh
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- A seminar and a photo exhibition were held by the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea and similar events and a film show by the Bangladesh Barisal Society for the Study of Songun Policy on Aug. 17 and 18 on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 On display in the venues of the photo exhibitions were photos on the Songun leadership feats performed by Kim Jong Il and other photos showing the invincible might of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 Secretary General of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea M. Gamrul Huda at the seminar titled "Songun and accomplishment of socialist cause" referred to the facts that Kim Jong Il propounded the idea of placing the army before the working class on the basis of a scientific insight into the changed specific conditions and has energetically led the work to firmly prepare the KPA politically and ideologically and in military technique as a driving force for accomplishing the socialist cause. 
					
					 Advisor of the Bangladesh Barisal Society for the Study of Songun Policy M. Jahangir Khan at the seminar entitled "The most powerful and dignified politics of independence" stressed that the Korean people have demonstrated the dignity as an independent nation in the international arena thanks to the Songun politics. 
					
					  The participants of the film show watched Korean film "Reply of Korea."

articles.title: Warm Devotion
articles.content:
Warm Devotion
Pyongyang, August 26 (KCNA) -- A small group of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army led by President Kim Il Sung was billeted in a valley in the early winter of Juche 29 (1940).
					 Anti-Japanese Heroine Kim Jong Suk went to a brook with laundry after other guerrillas fell fast asleep.
					
					 She cracked ice defying piercing cold and washed clothes. And then she drove sticks into the ground by the campfire to spread out the clothes.
					
					 At that time, an order of emergency call was issued.
					
					 She took in the washings quickly and joined the ranks.
					
					 When the group marched to another camping site at dawn, she entered the tent of the headquarters, carrying the smoothed clothes.
					
					 The moment the President saw her face so pale from cold and the dried clothes, he guessed what had happened and scolded her, saying who let her do so.
					
					 Then the guerrillas realized that she dried the washings, keeping them in her bosom.
					
					 The warm devotion shown by Kim Jong Suk was the acme of loyalty to the leader never to be seen in the world.

articles.title: Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Congo Democratico
articles.content:
Nombrado nuevo embajador coreano en Congo Democratico
Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ATCC) -- Segun el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Myong Chol fue nombrado como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la RPDC en la Republica Democratica del Congo.

articles.title: Funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang"
articles.content:
Funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang"
Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ATCC) -- En el Estadio Primero de Mayo situado en la isla Rungra de esta capital tiene lugar en medio de gran interes y esperanza del interior y el exterior la funcion gimnastico-artistica masiva "Arirang", obra laureada con el "Premio Kim Il Sung".
					Esta funcion cuya semilla es la cancion folclorica "Arirang" es una obra monumental del nuevo siglo, creada combinando el problema del destino de la nacion coreana con la historia de la Revolucion Coreana.
					
					La obra esta compuesta del prologo, 4 actos principales y el epilogo y contiene abundantes contenidos ideo-tematicos.
					
					El prologo con el epigrafe "Arirang", que tiene el sol saliente como fondo, y el primer acto muestran con gran emocion a traves de las canciones famosas las inmortales hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien libero al pais de infortunio.
					
					El segundo acto "Arirang de Songun", integrante de los bailes especificos y canciones jubilosas y formacion de gimnasia, muestra la realidad de Corea desplegada maravillosamente gracias al Songun (priorizacion militar) y la vida feliz del pueblo trabajador que disfruta bajo su beneficio.
					
					El tercer acto "Arirang de felicidad" se caracteriza por el acto mas especifico en la presente representacion.
					
					Los elegantes movimientos de las bailadoras con flores de escarchas y Oungum (instrumento musical nacional) en sus manos, los movimentos habiles de los acrobatas y los ritmos de bailadoras con las flores y cintas en sus manos llevan al publico a un mundo muy alegre.
					
					El cuarto acto "Arirang de reunificacion" y el epilogo "Arirang de la prosperidad" describen bien la firme voluntad del pueblo coreano dispuesto a lograr la reunificacion de la patria dividida y construir una gran potencia prospera.
					
					Todas las escenas, canciones, pinturas e inscripciones de la pizarra humana demuestran vividamente la realidad de Corea del Juche.

articles.title: Mas de 460 mil personas visitan lugar historico de Ryongpho
articles.content:
Mas de 460 mil personas visitan lugar historico de Ryongpho
Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ATCC) -- Durante los 8 anos desde cuando el Dirigente Kim Jong Il dirigio sobre el terreno el 26 de agosto del 90 (2001) de la Era Juche el lugar de interes  historico-revolucionario de Ryongpho en los dias de la direccion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun (priorizacion militar) hasta la fecha, visitaron este lugar mas de 460 mil militares del Ejercito Popular de Corea, trabajadores de distintos estratos, jovenes y ninos escolares.
					   El Presidente Kim Il Sung vino a dicho lugar por entre la lluvia de balas en abril del 40 (1951) de la Era Juche cuando se desarrollaba enconadamente la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, trazo personalmente el plan operacional para la defensa de la costa oriental y llamo a los oficiales y combatientes ejemplares de la unidad combinada del EPC a realizar proezas.
					
					  Ese dia de agosto, el Dirigente recorrio las reliquias historico-revolucionarias de ahi y presento las tareas y medios para conservar y administrar como estado original los  datos, objetos y lugares historicos-revolucionarios y realizar la educacion sustancial mediante ellos.

articles.title: Japon debe ganar primero confianza de la sociedad internacional
articles.content:
Japon debe ganar primero confianza de la sociedad internacional
 Pyongyang, 26 de agosto (ATCC) -- Es una ambicion anejada de Japon ocupar la posicion de miembro permanente del Consejo de Seguridad, cargo importante de la ONU, para convertirse en una potencia politica.
					  Para este fin, el considera este tema como nucleo de su politica exterior.
					
					  Como lo hizo todos los anos, este ano tambien lo planteo como la mas importante tarea diplomatica.
					
					  El Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de Japon anoto oficialmente en el "libro azul de diplomacia" de la edicion de 2009 la necesidad de hacerse cuanto antes miembro permanente del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU.
					
					  El canciller y otros funcionarios encargados de relaciones exteriores andan enfrascados en la diplomacia pecuniaria y mendigante en los escenarios internacionales expresando abiertamente tal ambicion irracional.
					
					  Pero, estas pretensiones de Japon le hacen pasar tremenda verguenza en todas partes.
					
					  Nadie tiene la culpa de que Japon no haya convencido a la sociedad internacional aunque realizo ingentes esfuerzos.
					
					  Pues, Japon no esta preparado en lo politico y moral para ser miembro permanente del Consejo de Seguridad.
					
					  En una palabra, es desconfiado hoy por la sociedad internacional por no haber liquidado todavia el expediente de sus crimenes del pasado.
					
					  Aunque pasaron mas de 60 anos desde el fin de la Segunda Guerra Mundial que causo grandes perdidas a la humanidad, Japon se resiste todavia a cumplir esa obligacion legal y moral que corresponde al pais criminal de guerra.
					
					  Es imposible que tal pais isleno haga el uso de la palabra en el trato de los importantes asuntos politicos internacionales en calidad de miembro permanente del Consejo de Seguridad.
					
					  En este sentido, tomar reflexiones sinceras de su pasado bochornoso beneficiara mas a Japon que a otros paises.
					
					  Ahora, le falta a Japon la facultad de enjuiciar la realidad. Es decir, no entiende que nunca podra alcanzar su meta politica si no gana la confianza internacional.
					
					  Lo demuestra el hecho de que Japon intensifica sus acciones en pro de la militarizacion y la agresion a ultramar hablando tanto de la "contribucion internacional", lejos de liquidar sus enormes crimenes del pasado.
					
					  Ahora, crece en la sociedad internacional el rechazo a tal proposito de Japon.
					
					  Se incrementa el numero de los paises que expusieron su posicion oficial contra el intento de Japon.
					
					En varios paises, incluyendo los asiaticos, se libra ampliamente la recogida de firmas para expresar la oposicion.
					
					  Es muy natural que Japon fuera desconfiado en la arena internacional porque este pais imbecil en lo politico anda con fanfarroneria creyendo que con el dinero se resuelve lo todo y emprende de nuevo el camino de agresion, en lugar de sacar lecciones de su pasado lleno de crimenes.  
					
					Si Japon quiere ejercer algun derecho en el escenario internacional, debera liquidar primero sus crimenes del pasado.
